title: If your wifi goes down, you still get dodged penalties
body: Even though you didnt close client and you didnt actually leave the lobby. I was last pick and disconnected for less than a minute after first pick. I know it wasnt my turn to pick but I was still kicked and given dodge penalties. Why

replies.body:
DONT PLAY OVER WIFI

DURP


ELSE GO BUY A POWERLINE ADAPTER
Not everyone has money you know.... Not everyone needs one. It's not even like it matters that much. It just may go down once every few months for about a minute. Not that big of a deal. Chill out.

When you disconnect from a champ select, it negatively impacts everyone in the match, regardless if the disconnection was intentional or not. This is one of the reasons why the system treats all disconnections equally and queue timers cannot be modified.

It sounds like your connection isn't completely stable, and there are a number reasons why this may be. I recommend [creating a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with our tech specialists so they can work with you to resolve this.

To expedite your ticket, you can run a set of logs using our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs) and attach them to your request.
Ive seen other people disconnect and reconnect to the lobby. The chat says "_____ has disconnected" later saying they reconnected. The lobby doesnt end at that point.

There are typically two different types of disconnections that can happen in champ select. One is a disconnection from the platform called PVP.net, which allows you to chat and interact with other players. If you disconnect from this, it's possible to continue interacting with champ select. The other is a disconnection from the League servers entirely, which will typically not allow you to continue interacting with champ select.

I hope this clears up the confusion, please let me know if you have any other questions.
